title: Joint Probes to Continue Post-Brexit-With More Red Tape
summary: A last-minute trade and cooperation deal contains measures that the U.K. hopes will help maintain cross-border collaboration with law enforcement in the EU. The last-minute trade deal between the U.K. and European Union has helped stave off a potentially turbulent disruption in key law enforcement and security priorities between the two sides.

title: Joe Biden's Impeachment Moment
summary: He'd help the country and his Presidency by calling off the House.. House Speaker Nancy Pelosi is barreling ahead on a vote to impeach President Trump this week-days before a new President takes office, and with the outcome and timing of a Senate trial uncertain. This is a moment for Joe Biden to establish his leadership by calling off the House impeachers in service of his vow that this is a "time to heal."

title: Boss Madigan Teeters in Illinois
summary: He's still short of the votes needed for another term as House speaker.. The man most responsible for the dreadful condition of Illinois politics and the state's finance has finally suffered a tentative defeat. On Monday Mike Madigan, the speaker of the Illinois House for all but two years since 1983, said he will suspend his attempt to seek the 60 votes he needs for another term as the boss.

title: Google Sued by YouTube Rival Over Search Rankings
summary: Video-sharing site Rumble, citing a Wall Street Journal investigation, alleges Google diverted traffic away from it toward YouTube. Video-sharing site Rumble Inc. accused Google in a lawsuit of abusing the power of its search engine and mobile operating system to boost its YouTube video service over rivals, the latest allegation of anticompetitive conduct against the Alphabet Inc. unit.

title: A Case of Blindside Regulation
summary: The Justices can rein in an FTC that increasingly exceeds its authority.. The Biden Administration is expected to unleash regulators on business. So it's good timing that the Supreme Court on Wednesday will hear a case (AMG Capital v. FTC) challenging the Federal Trade Commission's abuse of its regulatory power.

title: Donor Privacy at the Supreme Court
summary: Xavier Becerra's policy on nonprofits is in the dock.. Xavier Becerra has been nominated to run the Department of Health and Human Services, but his current California office is going to the Supreme Court. The Justices agreed on Friday to hear a pair of lawsuits opposing California's blanket policy that charities must turn over the names and addresses of their major donors.

title: National Guard Bolsters D.C. Troop Levels to at Least 10,000
summary: Added forces expected in place by weekend as FBI warns of armed protests nationwide in run-up to inauguration. U.S. officials ordered thousands of extra National Guard troops to Washington, D.C., by the weekend as part of new security measures that include halting public tours of the Washington Monument, as authorities warn of armed protests in the nation's capital and across the country in coming days.

title: Joining a Startup May Not Be as Appealing as It Once Was
summary: Young job seekers are weighing the importance of security in an uncertain employment market during the pandemic. If you are re-evaluating your priorities while job hunting, you aren't alone. The pandemic that has thrown the economy into tumult has increased job seekers' desire for stability. While some young workers are wary of working for a startup during a period of uncertainty, others think there is no better time to get on board the next Airbnb or Uber-both of which formed during the 2007-09 recession.

title: Turkish Democracy Isn't a Lost Cause
summary: Its restoration would advance American interests abroad.. The Biden administration is expected to shift U.S. foreign policy in ways that could aid the cause I have advocated for many years: rights and freedoms for people in Turkey, my home country. As a modern, prosperous Muslim nation, Turkey was often touted to Middle Eastern autocracies as a role model and a better way. But in only a decade it has become one of them-another autocracy.

title: CIO Scramble to Equip Remote Workers Sparked Best PC Growth Rate in Decade
summary: Rising demand for remote schooling, home entertainment also drove sales. The shift to remote work is jolting the lackluster personal computer market, as chief information officers and other corporate information-technology leaders raced to equip stay-at-home workers during the coronavirus pandemic, analysts say.

title: FBI Warns of Possible Nationwide Armed Protests Ahead of Biden Inauguration
summary: Internal memo warns demonstrations may start later this week. The FBI is warning in an internal memo of the possibility of armed protests at all 50 state capitols and in Washington, D.C., ahead of President-elect Joe Biden's Jan. 20 inauguration, a law-enforcement official said.

title: PC Sales Notch Strongest Growth in a Decade
summary: Pandemic drives sales as employees and students do their work remotely. Personal computer sales last year registered their strongest growth in a decade, underscoring a shift to computers from mobile devices during the coronavirus pandemic, according to industry data.

title: Business School Students Study Corporate Covid-19 Challenges
summary: M.B.A. programs consider case studies inspired by the pandemic. Many students in M.B.A. programs will find themselves analyzing management decisions made during the pandemic when they return to their business classes this spring semester. But students in some programs have already begun to study corporate pandemic challenges and crisis management.

title: Why I'm Taking a Social-Media Sabbatical
summary: Going without Facebook and Twitter will make me a better husband, father, citizen and Christian.. I'm suspending indefinitely my use of Twitter , Facebook and other social media. I'm doing so not to make a political statement, but in the hope that America can return to kitchen tables, churches, taverns, coffee shops, dance halls (it's a Texas thing)-whatever it takes to look others in the eye and rebuild our communities and humanity.

title: Fox News and CNN Shuffle Anchor Lineups
summary: Fox News is adding a new opinion show, and CNN is giving anchor Jake Tapper an extra hour during weekdays. Fox News and CNN announced substantial changes to their lineups Monday, as cable news channels look to capitalize on continued viewer interest in politics two months after the presidential election.

title: Notable & Quotable: Peter Huber on the Plague
summary: 'Government contractors will never be agile enough to keep up with germs.'. From "The Coming Plague," an April 10, 2007, Journal op-ed by Manhattan Institute fellow Peter Huber, who died Jan. 8 at 68:

title: 'Kamala's Way' Review: Getting to Know the Next in Line
summary: She is notably less moderate (or, if you'd prefer, more progressive) than Joe Biden-a source of strength to voters on the left.. One consequence of the events of Jan. 6-in which Mike Pence could be said to have protected the Constitution from his own president-should be that American voters will come to pay as fierce attention to the mettle of their prospective vice presidents as they do to that of their presidential candidates.

title: All Donald Trump's Deplorables
summary: Even Hillary Clinton consigned only half of Trump supporters to her infamous 'basket.'. Whatever political future Donald Trump might have envisioned for himself is now dead. He squandered a good chunk of it in the Georgia runoffs, when he made them all about himself instead of about keeping Republican control over the Senate. But it was finished off by the mob of his own supporters who stormed the Capitol this past Wednesday and inflicted more lasting damage on their man than anything his enemies ever managed.

title: Beijing Won't Bow to Bluster on Taiwan
summary: Biden will have to coordinate a military buildup with allies to stop a catastrophe.. Secretary of State Mike Pompeo's announcement last week that he's lifting restrictions on meetings between U.S. and Taiwanese officials will enrage Beijing, but the impact on Taiwan's security is harder to judge.

title: The Staying Inside Guide: Jazz, Up Close and Personal
summary: With in-person concerts still shut down, a chance to improvise on the jazz-club experience-from virtual tours of Louis Armstrong's house to performances that rework the music of Stevie Wonder and Erykah Badu..

title: Much of Second-Round Covid-19 Stimulus Money Has Been Paid
summary: Eligible individuals who don't receive a check, debit card or direct deposit will have to request the money when filing their 2020 tax returns. President Trump on Dec. 27 signed into law a roughly $900 billion coronavirus aid package that provides a second round of stimulus payments to households, and the money is already flowing. The Treasury Department said Jan. 7 that it had paid $130 billion of the estimated $164 billion total. Here is what we know about who will receive the payments and how they will receive the money.

title: Online Platform eToro Called in Trades When Bitcoin Price Peaked
summary: The platform closed all cryptocurrency margin trades in Europe around the time bitcoin hit a high on Friday; prices later plunged. A popular online brokerage abruptly curbed trading in cryptocurrencies just as bitcoin hit a record high, catching investors in one of the hottest corners of the market off guard.

title: 'Drunk Tank Pink' by Shame Review: Alienation With a South London Accent
summary: British band Shame's evocative lyrics and propulsive beats stand out in London's crowded, post-punk scene..

title: Blackstone Hires Former Brown Endowment Chief
summary: Addition of Joe Dowling signals a new focus on the funds as big generators of return.

title: NYPD Probes Officer's Possible Participation in Capitol Riot
summary: New York police commissioner says authorities are scrutinizing active member in connection with pro-Trump mob's storming of federal legislature. The New York Police Department's Internal Affairs Bureau is probing an active member in connection with last week's riot in Washington, D.C., where five people died after Trump supporters attacked the U.S. Capitol, Commissioner Dermot Shea said in a television interview on NY1 on Monday.

title: Minneapolis Police Union Head to Retire Early
summary: Lt. Bob Kroll was an outspoken critic of the city's handling of unrest after the killing of George Floyd. Lt. Bob Kroll, the outspoken head of the Police Officers Federation of Minneapolis, said Monday he plans to retire at the end of the month, citing family reasons.

title: TikTok, Discord Are the New Wall Street Trading Desks
summary: Pandemic has led to surge of day trading, helping push stocks like NIO and Tesla to records amid online buzz. A new army of social media-enabled day traders is helping push stocks to records and turning companies into market sensations.

title: New York Gov. Andrew Cuomo Outlines Wide Ranging Recovery Plan for State
summary: Annual State of the State agenda items included converting vacant commercial space into housing and actions to combat coronavirus while rebuilding economy. New York Gov. Andrew Cuomo said the state would expand broadband internet access, create public health training for citizens and support the conversion of vacant commercial space into housing as the Empire State strives to overcome the coronavirus crisis that has taken a stunning economic toll.

title: Vaccine Queen
summary: For a shot in the arm, go to states with small governments.. It's maddening to watch politicians like Gov. Andrew Cuomo (D., N.Y.) delay needed Covid vaccinations with needless bureaucracy. For any citizens crying out that there has to be a better way, the good news is that a number of states have been moving quickly to get shots into arms. Recently this column noted the speed of vaccinations in West Virginia. Fortunately the Mountain State is not the only success story.

title: New York City's High Line Park to Expand to Moynihan Train Hall
summary: A $60 million extension would stretch east to Manhattan West complex adjacent to transport hub. Gov. Andrew Cuomo on Monday revealed plans to connect Manhattan's aerial park, the High Line, to a new $1.6 billion train hall that opened at the start of this year.

title: Sixth Street Partners Nears Deal for Majority Stake in Legends Hospitality Group
summary: Deal values the sports-and-entertainment events company at $1.3 billion, including debt. Investment firm Sixth Street Partners is nearing a deal to buy a majority stake in sports-and-entertainment events company Legends Hospitality LLC, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: Some Banks Want to Consign Credit-Card Interest to History
summary: Australian lenders hope no-interest cards can arrest a decline in usage and attract younger customers. SYDNEY-Interest charges have been one of the defining features of credit cards for decades and so when an employee at a big Australian bank suggested getting rid of them, he was taking a risk.

title: Trade Chief Lighthizer Urges Biden to Keep Tariffs on China
summary: The lawyer who engineered the Trump administration's trade war with Beijing says tariffs get results. WASHINGTON-In his nearly four years in office, U.S. Trade Representative Robert Lighthizer helped move protectionism from the fringes of American policy-making to the core. His advice to the Biden administration: Stay the course.

title: U.S. Stocks Finish Lower on New Risks
summary: The Dow falls after ending last week at its third record close of 2021. A slide in shares of technology giants weighed on the broader market Monday as investors grew wary of the potential for heightened regulation tied to the market's most enduring winners.

title: Chewy Co-Founder Joins GameStop's Board
summary: Ryan Cohen wants videogame retailer to pare store count, focus on digital market. GameStop Corp. said it has struck a deal with Chewy Inc. co-founder Ryan Cohen to add him and two former colleagues to its board after he pushed the company to better focus on digital sales.

title: Treasury Yield Climb Continues
summary: The climb extended even as U.S. stock indexes fell. U.S. government bond yields rose Monday despite a decline in stocks, marking their sixth-consecutive session of gains after logging the biggest one-week increase since June.

title: Mississippi Governor Signs Law for Flag Without Confederate Emblem
summary: Legislators retired the last state flag in the U.S. that included the rebel symbol just over six months ago. JACKSON, Miss.-Mississippi Gov. Tate Reeves on Monday signed a bill that gives the state a new flag that has a magnolia and that no longer carries the Confederate battle emblem.

title: Parler Sues Amazon After Tech Giant Kicks Site Off Its Servers
summary: Lawsuit seeks order to prevent Amazon from shutting down social-media platform's account. Social-media platform Parler has sued Amazon.com Inc. after the tech giant abruptly ended web-hosting services to the company, effectively halting its operation.

title: A Few Brief Words (Tuesday Crossword, January 12)
New York Begins Covid-19 Vaccinations of People 75 and Older
summary: Resume Subscription. New York on Monday began administering Covid-19 vaccinations to people age 75 and older, educators, police officers and transit workers, broadening the pool of eligible recipients as it races to curb a second wave of the virus.

title: Trump's Economy Will Launch Joe Biden's
summary: Joe Biden arguably gets the best of all policy-measurement worlds when he enters the White House.. Jason Furman recapped "The Policy Lessons of the 'Trump Economy'" (op-ed, Dec. 30) in a generally nonpartisan manner. Presidents are often at the mercy of uncontrollable events and the business cycle and an assessment of long-term results of a president's policies based on shorter-term marginal benefits or detriments is dicey, at best. Mr. Furman's summary of the difficulties in measuring a president's policy results is welcome, although one doesn't recall him saying during his time as chairman of the White House Council of Economic Advisers that it was premature to give President's Obama's policies too much credit for an extended (but not very robust) recovery.

title: Right Price Can Make an M.B.A. a Good Buy
summary: The decision is much simpler when the price of an accredited M.B.A. is only $22,500, and when one can complete it without career interruption.. The central question posed by "The Pros And Cons of an M.B.A." (Personal Journal, Jan. 4) is whether the cost is worth it. It is true that most programs will cost over $100,000, and much more if one considers foregone earnings.

title: Merit and Diversity Need Not Be in Conflict
summary: Joseph Epstein seems to insinuate that the race, color and gender type of diversity happens often as a trade-off to merit and accomplishment.. Regarding Joseph Epstein's "The Tyranny of Diversity" (op-ed, Dec. 31): Mr. Epstein questions the "true value" of diversity based on race, color and gender in progressive politics and work culture, and takes President-elect Joe Biden's efforts for a diverse cabinet as one example. He suggests that the best way to celebrate diversity is to begin by celebrating "diversity of thought," which can stem from "the value of true merit, or the real abilities of the people chosen to perform their jobs."

title: Progressives Choose School Choice for Their Children
summary: In a world full of endless options, why is education the only area in which choice is squeezed and discouraged?. If Miguel Cardona truly favors students over unions, school choice will be his top priority ("Will Biden's Education Nominee Stand for Students or for Unions?" by Karl Zinsmeister, op-ed, Dec. 23). If we conducted business in the manner we assign public-school enrollment, U.S. companies would still be using rotary phones and mimeograph paper.

title: Ford to Cut 5,000 Jobs as it Stops Building Vehicles in Brazil
summary: The auto maker will close all three of its Brazilian factories as part of a broader turnaround effort. Ford Motor Co. will stop building vehicles in Brazil in an effort to shore up money-losing operations overseas, the company said, part of a broader turnaround effort under new Chief Executive Officer Jim Farley.

title: U.S. to Designate Yemen's Houthis as Terrorist Group
summary: Listing intended to curb Tehran's influence could also impair economy and peace efforts in country at risk of famine. The U.S. plans to designate the Iran-backed Houthis in Yemen as a foreign terrorist group, a move some Western officials and aid agencies said would impede stalled peace talks and hurt the economy of an impoverished nation at risk of famine.

title: Michael Madigan Suspends Campaign for Illinois House Speaker
summary: Long-serving power broker steps aside to let someone else seek 60 votes in caucus. Illinois House Speaker Michael Madigan, the longest-serving state house speaker in U.S. history, on Monday suspended his campaign to remain in the post after failing to win enough votes in a Democratic caucus on Sunday.

title: Carnival Set to Post $2.2 Billion Quarterly Loss
summary: Timing for resuming U.S. voyages ultimately depends on receiving permit from CDC. Carnival Corp. said it is continuing to burn cash and expects to post another sizable loss after almost a year since onboard coronavirus outbreaks brought its voyages to a halt in the U.S.

title: Joe Biden Receives Second Dose of Covid-19 Vaccine
summary: President-elect got first shot Dec. 21 and has now completed the regimen ahead of his Jan. 20 inauguration. President-elect Joe Biden received his second dose of the Covid-19 vaccine on Monday, completing the regimen ahead of his Jan. 20 inauguration, and said he would release a vaccine distribution plan later this week.

title: New York State Bar Association Weighs Stripping Giuliani of Membership
summary: Legal group cites complaints about President Trump's personal attorney in recent months. The New York State Bar Association said it has opened an investigation into whether it should eject Rudy Giuliani from the organization, an extraordinary move that follows President Trump's personal attorney's role on the day of the Capitol Hill riot last week.

title: U.K. Hospitals Brace for Covid-19 Pandemic's Worst Weeks
summary: January case surge in Britain threatens to overwhelm National Health Service as new coronavirus variant spreads. LONDON-Britain's National Health Service is bracing for the worst weeks of the pandemic as a new, more-contagious form of the coronavirus rips through the country and places hospitals under more extreme stress than in the spring.

title: Staples Seeks to Buy Office Depot, Again
summary: Antitrust enforcers have blocked two previous efforts to merge office superstore rivals. The owner of Staples made an unsolicited offer to take over Office Depot in a deal worth more than $2 billion, looking to unite the rival office-supply superstores whose previous marriage attempts have been thwarted by competition concerns.

title: James 'Jim Bob' Moffett, Who Helped Build Freeport-McMoRan, Dies at 82
summary: Wildcatting geologist followed intuition to earth's natural resources, drew ire of environmental groups. James "Jim Bob" Moffett, an oil wildcatter turned mining prospector who helped build Freeport-McMoRan Inc. into a natural-resources giant, has died at age 82.

title: Biden to Tap William J. Burns as CIA Director
summary: Former envoy served as U.S. ambassador to Russia and Jordan and as deputy secretary of state. WASHINGTON-President-elect Joe Biden plans to nominate William J. Burns, a former career diplomat with 33 years of service, as director of the Central Intelligence Agency, filling in the last top slot on his national security team.

title: Fed Sent $88.5 Billion in Profits to U.S. Treasury in 2020
summary: Remittances rose last year for the first time since 2015. WASHINGTON-The Federal Reserve sent $88.5 billion in profits to the U.S. Treasury Department in 2020, a nearly two-thirds increase from the previous year as lower rates held down the central bank's interest expense.

title: Trump's Post-Riot Troubles With Sports
summary: The golf world is fleeing from the president, and the Patriots coach is scheduled to receive the Presidential Medal of Freedom as Trump's final days in office highlight his uncomfortable relationship with sports. About a week ago, New England Patriots coach Bill Belichick was invited to receive America's highest citizen honor: the Presidential Medal of Freedom.

title: Supreme Court Rejects Trump Plea to Expedite Election Appeals
summary: Court won't consider cases until after Biden takes office; justices are under no obligation to hear the appeals. WASHINGTON-The Supreme Court rejected pleas from President Trump and his allies to expedite their pending challenges to November's election, all but assuring the justices won't consider the appeals before Joe Biden assumes the presidency Jan. 20.

title: Pope Francis Says Women Can Read at Mass
summary: Papal decree formalizes common practice, but pontiff doesn't address whether women can serve as deacons. ROME-Pope Francis, who has disappointed women pressing for ordination as clergy, has now made a more modest change to their role in Catholic worship, formally permitting them to read prayers and scripture at Mass.

title: Save the Constitution From Big Tech
summary: Congressional threats and inducements make Twitter and Facebook censorship a free-speech violation.. Facebook and Twitter banned President Trump and numerous supporters after last week's disgraceful Capitol riot, and Google, Apple and Amazon blocked Twitter alternative Parler-all based on claims of "incitement to violence" and "hate speech." Silicon Valley titans cite their ever-changing "terms of service," but their selective enforcement suggests political motives.

title: No Excuses for Trump and the Capitol Riot
summary: Yes, the left does bad things too. Conservatives are supposed to believe in objective moral truth.. It's a measure of the depravity to which our national political conversation has fallen that however bad one side's latest transgression against norms, morality or the law, there's always something it can point to that the other side did first. The earlier outrage may not exactly justify the latest offense. But by reminding an already highly partisan audience that there is prior sinfulness in the actions of your opponents, you can dilute the negative public impact of your own wrongdoing or, at a minimum, apply some balm to a troubled private conscience.

title: How to Keep Your Art Safe From Damage, Both Natural and Man-made
summary: Resume Subscription. Finding a perfect piece of art to fill that blank space in your home can be like the proverbial needle in a haystack. But once you own it, how do you protect that painting or sculpture? Protection includes insurance, for sure, but it means more than just securing a policy.

title: Retail Tenants Leverage Pandemic Stress for Rent Cuts
summary: Some retailers, restaurants, gyms and other businesses are experiencing improved lease terms as they gain the upper hand over landlords looking to retain tenants. U.S. commercial landlords have granted billions of dollars of rent relief to struggling storefronts as property owners strive to keep falling occupancy rates from triggering more severe financial consequences.

title: Welcome to the Fake Office Commute (Turns Out People Miss the Routine)
summary: Resume Subscription. For more than a decade, Holly Hein rode the #10 bus 45 minutes to her administrative job at Portland State University in Oregon. She would plop onto her usual spot at the back of the bus and "space out" with a book. At close of business, she would repeat the ritual in reverse.

title: Lilly's Alzheimer's News Brings Plenty of Upside, Limited Risk
summary: Betting that this time is different for a promising Alzheimer's disease treatment is a fairly inexpensive wager. Positive data from Eli Lilly 's experimental Alzheimer's disease treatment is hopeful news for patients and, for now, a winner on Wall Street.

title: When to Skip the Emergency Room for Other Options
summary: With the pandemic overloading many emergency rooms and ICUs, the hospital isn't always the best place to seek treatment for some ailments. With emergency rooms and ICUs across the country overloaded, a trip to the hospital can mean greater pandemic-related risks. According to the Covid Tracking Project, more than 132,000 people are in hospital with Covid-19, with the majority of states reporting record hospitalizations. That affects not just emergency departments but staffing and space throughout entire hospitals, which usually isolate Covid patients to prevent infection.

title: Biden Faces No-Win Choice: Play Avenger or Conciliator?
summary: Despite the president-elect's goal of national unity, many Democrats want him to endorse impeachment. President-elect Joe Biden faces a lot of tough choices as he heads into office, but he now confronts a particularly fraught one: Does he play the role of avenger or conciliator?

summary: Brand once favored by skinheads touts its potential to grow in the U.S., China. Dr. Martens, the maker of the chunky leather lace-up boots that were first embraced by skinheads and rockers, wants to join the establishment.

summary: Scientists say even vaccinated people need to take Covid precautions. Do the Covid vaccines prevent you from spreading the virus, or do they just protect you from getting sick?

title: Netanyahu Orders New Jewish Settlement Homes in Israeli-Occupied West Bank
summary: Trump administration supported such projects but will soon be replaced by more critical President-elect Biden. TEL AVIV-Israel's Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said he ordered his government to expand Jewish settlements in the West Bank, an early test for the administration of President-elect Joe Biden who has been a fierce critic of projects built on land that the Palestinians claim for a future state.

title: Lilly Alzheimer's Drug Helped Patients in Small Trial
summary: Donanemab slowed cognitive and functional decline of patients with mild Alzheimer's by 32% compared with placebo. An experimental Alzheimer's drug from Eli Lilly & Co. helped patients in a small trial, the company said Monday, renewing hopes that researchers are closing in on therapies that can fight the disease.

title: The NBA's Most Improbable Player Now Has a Podcast
summary: Duncan Robinson, a Division-III recruit who became one of the world's best 3-point shooters, is taking the next step of his career: his own podcast. The wildly unlikely story of Duncan Robinson is already the stuff of basketball legend.

title: China's Chip-Independence Goals Helped by U.S.-Developed Tech
summary: New approach to semiconductors, developed partly with the Pentagon's backing, could threaten Intel and Arm's dominance. title: Eli Lilly, Twitter, NIO: What to Watch When the Stock Market Opens Today
summary: U.S. stock futures are sliding amid political risks and economic uncertainties. Here's what we're watching ahead of the opening bell on Monday.

title: Capitol Riot Puts More Scrutiny on Big Tech
summary: Lawmakers are expected to push to scale back technology companies' liability shield. WASHINGTON-The storming of the Capitol by supporters of President Trump is expected to turbocharge Congressional efforts to regulate big tech-and many lawmakers are expected to focus on scaling back the liability shield that protects internet companies.

title: Indonesia First to Approve Sinovac Vaccine Outside China
summary: Nation's emergency-use approval comes despite trial results placing the shot at 65.3%, the low end of efficacy range. Indonesia became the first country outside China to give emergency use approval to a Covid-19 vaccine developed by Chinese drugmaker Sinovac Biotech Ltd., despite findings that place the candidate's efficacy among the lowest for new coronavirus vaccines.

title: Mercy! Cleveland Browns, Playoff Bullies, Dunk Steelers
summary: A playoff stranger makes up for lost time. Their next opponent should be a lot tougher. It felt like a playoff game and an exorcism.

title: Indonesia Crash Investigators Await Black Boxes
summary: Pings detected as divers face sharp, heavy debris from shattered plane in Java Sea. As divers approached the underwater area where they expected to find the black boxes of Indonesia's Sriwijaya Air jet that crashed into the sea, it became clear their task wasn't going to be easy.

title: Covid-19 Hit Hardest Where Financial Crisis Led to Health-Care Cuts
summary: Southern European austerity budgets left the region ill-prepared for the virus. MILAN-Claudio Zanon has seen firsthand how less spending on health care in recent years left Italy exposed when the coronavirus began sweeping through his country early last year.

summary: Smalls says she's been missing Muay Thai during the pandemic.. In our series My Monday Morning, self-motivated people tell WSJ. how they start off the week.

title: PPP Loans: What We Know About Latest Small Business Protection
summary: First-time borrowers get first dibs through community lenders; $2 million max loan for second-time PPP borrowers. The loan program is reopening on Jan. 11, initially to first-time borrowers, with second-time borrowers to follow on Jan. 13.

title: Making an Apple EV Is a Poisoned Chalice for Car Companies
summary: Investors in Hyundai may be overestimating the benefits of a manufacturing contract, even from the world's most valuable company. An Apple car, if it is ever launched, would be a big deal. But the potential rewards for manufacturers come with a sting.

title: ICE's Cryptocurrency Venture to Go Public Through a SPAC
summary: ICE's Bakkt crypto venture plans to roll out an app for trading and making payments with digital assets. title: China's Car Sales Fell 6.8% in 2020, Likely Beating Other Markets
summary: The drop should be considered a success in the pandemic-struck 2020, analysts say. SHANGHAI-Chinese car sales declined 6.8% last year, as the world's largest market for automobiles shrank for a third straight year.

summary: If the firm reaches its goal, the new fund would be nearly 30% larger than its predecessor, which closed with $8.5 billion in 2019. title: The Great Outdoors Offers Retail Winners
summary: Both investors and consumers might find some lasting value in the outdoors. In a year during which a widespread return to theaters, concerts and travel remains up in the air, consumers are likely to continue finding value in outdoor activities. Investors might, too.

title: New Yorker Writer Shared Doubts on Japanese 'Family Rental' Article Before Publication
summary: The magazine has added an editor's note saying three leading figures in the article made false claims. TOKYO-A New Yorker staff writer who researched a "family rental" service in Japan expressed concern before publication that her sources might not be telling the truth, according to people who spoke with her.

title: China Allows WHO Experts in to Investigate Covid-19 Origins
summary: U.N. agency's top official earlier criticized Beijing for holding up mission. HONG KONG-China has agreed to allow a team of World Health Organization experts to enter the country to investigate the origins of the coronavirus pandemic, days after the United Nations agency's top official criticized Beijing for holding up the mission.

title: China Gives U.S. Tech the Silent Treatment
summary: Slow approval from Beijing is dragging out big technology deals, costing American companies time and money. Patience may be a virtue. For U.S. tech companies looking to do deals that involve China, it is also an expensive necessity.

title: OpenAP Adds Technology to Further Automate TV Ad Sales
summary: Ad giant Omnicom is testing new technology that shows commercials available to purchase from large TV networks. TV network group OpenAP is updating its technology to let advertisers see the commercial time that is available from its members, making its system more closely resemble digital ad platforms.

title: Chinese Management Companies are Suddenly Hot Property
summary: One niche segment of China's unloved property sector still has the government strongly in its corner. The post-pandemic year is shaping up as a tricky one for Chinese companies in the great real-estate game-at least the building part of it. Companies managing existing buildings, on the other hand, are suddenly shaping up as hot property themselves.

title: House to Move to Impeach Trump After Push to Have Pence Remove Him From Office
summary: House Speaker Nancy Pelosi says she will introduce a resolution on Monday; 'We will act with urgency'. WASHINGTON-House Speaker Nancy Pelosi (D., Calif) said the House will move to impeach President Trump as soon as this week if Vice President Mike Pence and the president's cabinet don't act to strip him of his powers over the riot at the U.S. Capitol.

title: Ban on Chinese Stocks Spurs Banks to Delist Derivatives
summary: Goldman Sachs, JPMorgan Chase, Morgan Stanley say warrants and callable bull/bear contracts will be suspended from trading Jan. 25. Goldman Sachs Group Inc., JPMorgan Chase & Co. and Morgan Stanley moved to delist hundreds of derivatives traded in Hong Kong, following a U.S. government ban on American investment in companies considered to be helping China's military.

title: Bluebird Bio to Spin Off Cancer-Drug Unit
summary: Pioneer in the field of gene therapies will split into one company focused on rare diseases and a second devoted to cancer therapies. Bluebird Bio Inc., a biotech pioneer in the field of gene therapies, plans to split itself in two later this year, spinning off its cancer-drug unit into a new, publicly traded company so it can focus on rare diseases.

title: U.S. Companies Revamp Bonus Plans as Pandemic Upends Forecasts
summary: Some boards are scrapping existing formulas and instead using their judgment to set annual incentives. Companies are revising their plans for bonuses and other incentive compensation as the coronavirus pandemic upended financial forecasts and executives managed through a once-in-a-lifetime economic downturn.

title: January Forces Some Schools to Extend Remote Learning, Others to Reopen Classrooms
summary: School schedules are expected to remain fluid as districts weigh rising coronavirus cases against concerns about the safety of students and teachers. School districts across the country are changing their plans with the new year, with some deciding to prolong remote instruction and others moving to reopen classrooms.

title: Cold Snap Sparks Record Rise in Natural Gas Prices in Asia
summary: Traders are struggling to secure enough vessels to transport LNG from the U.S. Gulf Coast to Asia in time to meet rampant demand. A blast of cold weather in northeast Asia and a shortage of ships for transporting gas have sparked a scramble for cargoes of liquefied natural gas, igniting a steep rise in prices.

title: Kim Jong Un Gets a Promotion, Demotes His Sister
summary: North Korean leader takes the title of general secretary as Kim Yo Jong is removed from the top decision-making body. SEOUL-Kim Jong Un has given himself a lofty new title and removed his ascendant sister from North Korea's inner circle of powerful elites.

title: U.S. Covid-19 Vaccination Plan Limits Speed of Rollout, Supply-Chain Experts Say
summary: The decentralized effort focuses on supply with less attention to the last mile, or getting the 'vaccine from storage into people's arms'. A sluggish rollout of Covid-19 vaccines across the U.S. highlights the challenges of a decentralized distribution plan that relies on states and localities to handle the complicated last-mile logistics of getting shots into people's arms, supply-chain experts say.

title: Pepper...and Salt
summary: Resume Subscription. We are delighted that you'd like to resume your subscription.

title: Going to Pot (Monday Crossword, January 11)
PGA Removes 2022 Championship From Trump's N.J. Golf Course
summary: The PGA of America said it had terminated the agreement to play the tournament, one of golf's majors, at Trump's Bedminister, N.J. course. The move comes in the aftermath of last week's riot at the U.S. Capitol.. The PGA of America has stripped the 2022 PGA Championship from President Trump's New Jersey golf course, an example of the economic consequences that may await the departing leader in the aftermath of the riot at the U.S. Capitol.

title: Indonesia Plane Crash Search Finds Human Remains, Debris
summary: Hopes fade any survived as a search operation recovers pieces of the Boeing 737-500 plane that went down Saturday. JAKARTA, Indonesia-Authorities believe they have identified the location of the two so-called black boxes of the Sriwijaya Air jet that crashed into the Java Sea carrying 62 people.

title: More Alleged Capitol Rioters Charged
summary: The men were charged with violent entry and disorderly conduct on Capitol grounds, among other charges. Several men seen in now notorious images from the Jan. 6 riot in Washington were charged in federal court over the weekend with violent entry and disorderly conduct on Capitol grounds, among other charges. Federal officials also charged a newly elected West Virginia lawmaker in connection to the riot.

title: Capitol Riot Prompts Some Big Banks and Companies to Pause Political Funding
summary: JPMorgan and Citigroup to halt all PAC donations; Blue Cross and Marriott pause funding to Republicans who objected to Electoral College results. Two of the biggest U.S. banks and other corporations said they are pausing or reviewing their political action committee donations in the wake of last week's riot at the Capitol.

title: The Lies We Tell During Job Interviews
summary: Interviewers and candidates often end up in situations where they're almost encouraged to lie-here's what research says about how, why and how often it happens. Is a job interview really an exercise in deception? Career coaches and researchers who study falsehoods say yes.

title: Twitter, Facebook and Others Silenced Trump. Now They Learn What's Next.
summary: The social-media platforms' recent actions show the companies' influence over online discourse. Silicon Valley's moves to eject President Trump from social media represent a display of power the companies have avoided making for nearly four years. Now Twitter Inc., Facebook Inc. and others must reckon with what comes next.

title: New York Gets Boost With Sen. Schumer's Rise to Majority Leader
summary: Position will give Brooklyn Democrat the ability to steer funding and push policies that are of local concern. Leaders in business, labor and government across New York are cheering U.S. Sen. Chuck Schumer's coming elevation to majority leader after Democrats won two runoff elections in Georgia.
